text: The news is that the Amazon will bring some of its operations to Long Island City in Queens, with a promise of 25,000 jobs, They are concerned about how Long Island City will change and wonder how much financial incentives are being provided to the Amazon. During an interview with the New York Sports Centre, the host asked Brian Lehrer Komo about the kind of general oversight that would exist before the Amazon plans were finalized. The Komo response addressed the project approval process, as well as the financial incentives provided to the Amazon region. "There's nothing we've done in the Amazon that we haven't done with hundreds of other projects," said Komo. "There are hundreds of businesses in New York that receive these kinds of tax exemptions and capital grants, because, competitively, we have to work hard to get people to come here because of our tax structure." So the Amazon deal with the state of New York isn't unique? The State provided services in the Amazon region amounting to $1.7 billion, and New York City to $1.8 billion, according to an analysis by the Citizens ' Budget Committee. In general, the value of benefits increases as the number of jobs created by the Amazon increases. Excelsior credits are linked to the Amazon commitment to provide 25,000 jobs and invest $2.3 billion. The capital grant is linked to that initial commitment, as well as to other phases: up to 40,000 jobs and $3.6 billion in total investments.
